meanings.definition: The tendency to consider oneself as the center of all things.
meanings.sent1: Her egocentrisms often made it challenging to see things from others' perspectives.
meanings.sent2: His egocentrisms led him to believe that the world revolved around him.
meanings.sent3: Despite his egocentrisms, he still managed to be a good friend.
meanings.sent4: In a room full of egocentrisms, she stood out as the most self-absorbed.
meanings.sent5: The egocentrisms of the character made the story more interesting.

meanings.sent1: The constant selfies were a clear sign of her egocentrisms.
meanings.sent2: His egocentrisms made it hard for him to empathize with others.
meanings.sent3: His egocentrisms reached new heights when he bought a mirror for every room.
meanings.sent4: The egocentrisms in the room clashed, each wanting the spotlight.
meanings.sent5: The egocentrisms of the celebrity were well-known in the industry.

meanings.sent1: Her egocentrisms affected her relationships with those around her.
meanings.sent2: The politician's egocentrisms were evident in every speech he gave.
meanings.sent3: Despite his egocentrisms, he still managed to be a team player.
meanings.sent4: The egocentrisms of the artist shone through in every piece of work.
meanings.sent5: The egocentrisms of the boss made it difficult for employees to voice their opinions.
